channel.title: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]
channel.description:
Sup playas! It's been a while. If anyone still reads these forums then this just might be the thread for you! [img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/d/d6/Shingeki_no_Kyojin_manga_volume_1.jpg[/img] Do you like animes? Well you've come the right place. Do you absolutely hate animes? You've also come to the right place. I have an answer for both types of people: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Titan]Attack on Titan[/url] Summary:
For a century the surviving remnants of humankind have lived behind three concentric rings of immense walls which protect them against titans, marauding giant humanoids who seem to have no purpose other than to eat humans. Young Eren is dissatisfied with this, as he feels he is living in a cage and that humanity has grown too complacent. He is proven right when his town, which borders the outermost wall, is attacked and overrun by titans, who (among other people) eat his mother. This drives him to join the military, with whip-smart friend Armin and very capable adopted sister Mikasa in tow, with the ultimate goal of joining the Survey Corps, which forays out on dangerous missions to bring the fight to titans and assess humanity's hope of regaining lost territory from the titans. First, though, the second-ring city of Trost must be defended when the same immense, skinless titan who broke the gate at the outer ring years earlier appears and does the same there. As casualties mount during the desperate defense of Trost, a completely unexpected new hope emerges: a risky but powerful new weapon which could allow humanity to finally start taking the offensive if only it has the courage and trust necessary to exploit it. As Eren and company discover when they foray out with the Survey Corps, though, hitherto-unanticipated forces exist out in titan territory, and the biggest and most threatening of those may have everything to do with humanity's newest weapon.
[img]http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--dJ7Ow8lb--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/18slrg0rc6h9ogif.gif[/img] tldr; - it's a really well done anime. Jaw dropping visual effects (great art), very graphic for a tv show, the foreshadowing of the entire season is phenomenal, the story is very unique and lastly, it's considered the next best anime since Naruto and Bleach (lol). Seriously. If you like cartoons/anime at all, I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend it. Honestly, I'm surprised there isn't a topic already about it. Who's pumped for season 2?

item.source: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]

item.title: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:8, topic:543823”]Not really a fan of anime, however the tribute game for this is really fun: http://fenglee.com/game/aog/[/quote]I don’t like anime besides this show. It’s worth the watch for the 1st and 2nd episode.

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:9, topic:543823”]It’s overly hyped, also overly exaggerated. One thing I hate is that they turn every single conversation into the most dramatic scene from a play, I hate that and it gets on my nerves. Most of the characters are stupid, before attacking a Titan they feel they needed to let it know they’re coming by screaming at the top of their lungs, which eventually leads to them getting caught and eaten. It’s not a terrible watch, but don’t have high expectations from all the hype.

EDIT: All I said did sound a bit harsh. The fight scenes are really good and they are few far in between. But the best thing about the show is the soundtrack, best you’ll find in anime.[/quote]I understand, the show is very dramatic but I thought it was for good reason. The world they live in is so day-to-day and stressful that they are always winded up - that’s my take any way. Aside from the main characters who haven’t died, they make humans way to damn stupid and uncoordinated. One scene I remember when “Conny” tries to kill like a 9 meter titan and just straight up misses. They were training for 3 years. 3 years Tabbykiller. How do you just crash into a titan? I understand. Rewatching the 1st season you catch a lot more.

Read full topic
item.source: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]

item.title: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

It’s overly hyped, also overly exaggerated. One thing I hate is that they turn every single conversation into the most dramatic scene from a play, I hate that and it gets on my nerves. Most of the characters are stupid, before attacking a Titan they feel they needed to let it know they’re coming by screaming at the top of their lungs, which eventually leads to them getting caught and eaten. It’s not a terrible watch, but don’t have high expectations from all the hype.

EDIT: All I said did sound a bit harsh. The fight scenes are really good and they are few far in between. But the best thing about the show is the soundtrack, best you’ll find in anime.

Read full topic

item.title: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“naseem142, post:6, topic:543823”]Me and my friend are hooked to this series , right now were at almost episode 17 or 18 something like that. And i really love everything about it! It’s just amazing how the story goes , like emotions and funny moments too. And i also like how fudgeed up some giants look like :P[/quote]Titans*

I like the way the entire series is drawn, the graphic style is unique. I think I really like it compared to not liking other animes would be that it’s so realistic. The entire concept of the rest of the human race inside a ~200 mile wall and within that wall are two other walls. Just a very unique concept.

Hopefully they don’t ruin the show in the second season, but so far the manga (what the show is based on) is really good.

Read full topic

item.title: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:543823”]I’ve been watching this as much as possible on Toonami.
However, I just think it’s kind of a huge plot hole that these giants (the reason they built the walls in the first place) can just get right over the wall. Don’t you think they would have been like “just in case, lets add like 300 extra feet or so to these walls. You know, just in case”.[/quote]The main giant “Titan” or known as the Colossus Titan wasn’t known about when the walls were originally built and designed. The walls were designed to keep Titans who were less than 60m tall out. The Colossus/Armored titan is why they got screwed over in the first place but before then, Titans that tall were unheard of. (Episodes 1 and 2).

You should watch the dubbed/subbed version online and finish the whole series, its great.

Read full topic
item.source: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]

item.title: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’ve been watching this as much as possible on Toonami.
However, I just think it’s kind of a huge plot hole that these giants (the reason they built the walls in the first place) can just get right over the wall. Don’t you think they would have been like “just in case, lets add like 300 extra feet or so to these walls. You know, just in case”.

item.title: Attack on Titan [no spolilers] [NOT A REVIEW]
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Sup playas! It’s been a while. If anyone still reads these forums then this just might be the thread for you!

Do you like animes? Well you’ve come the right place. Do you absolutely hate animes? You’ve also come to the right place.

I have an answer for both types of people: Attack on Titan
Summary:

For a century the surviving remnants of humankind have lived behind three concentric rings of immense walls which protect them against titans, marauding giant humanoids who seem to have no purpose other than to eat humans. Young Eren is dissatisfied with this, as he feels he is living in a cage and that humanity has grown too complacent. He is proven right when his town, which borders the outermost wall, is attacked and overrun by titans, who (among other people) eat his mother. This drives him to join the military, with whip-smart friend Armin and very capable adopted sister Mikasa in tow, with the ultimate goal of joining the Survey Corps, which forays out on dangerous missions to bring the fight to titans and assess humanity's hope of regaining lost territory from the titans. First, though, the second-ring city of Trost must be defended when the same immense, skinless titan who broke the gate at the outer ring years earlier appears and does the same there. As casualties mount during the desperate defense of Trost, a completely unexpected new hope emerges: a risky but powerful new weapon which could allow humanity to finally start taking the offensive if only it has the courage and trust necessary to exploit it. As Eren and company discover when they foray out with the Survey Corps, though, hitherto-unanticipated forces exist out in titan territory, and the biggest and most threatening of those may have everything to do with humanity's newest weapon.

tldr; - it’s a really well done anime. Jaw dropping visual effects (great art), very graphic for a tv show, the foreshadowing of the entire season is phenomenal, the story is very unique and lastly, it’s considered the next best anime since Naruto and Bleach (lol).

Seriously. If you like cartoons/anime at all, I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend it. Honestly, I’m surprised there isn’t a topic already about it. Who’s pumped for season 2?

Read full topic
